text: Frederick (also spelled Frederic) is a masculine given name that means "peaceful ruler". The name is the English form of the German name Friedrich. The pronunciation of the name is [ fred-rik, -er-ik ]. This name ranked among the top 100 masculine names for the United States between 1880 and 1957. After that, the name became less popular. The name was number 536 in popularity in the United States in the late 2000s. At the same time it was number 99 in England. As Frederic, the name was used on a hurricane that struck the Gulf Coast of the United States in September 1979.This name was ranked #476 on the US Popular Names in 2021. == People == * Frederick Douglass , African-American social reformer, writer, and abolitionist * Frederick Banting , Canadian medical scientist and doctor * Frederick Sanger, British biochemist * Frederick Griffith, British bacteriologist ==References== Category:Given names
title: Frederick
